reviews.text: I would like to say a great thank you to Chris who served me today at the ticket office. He was very helpful and kind. Wonderful attitude and excellent service!

A great thank you to the staff member who helped me board the train to Cambridge with all my bike gear. I really appreciated your help. Unfortunately I did not get his name to thank him personally. After a miserabley windy ride,  I was grateful that you ensured I was on the correct place to get on with the bike. Cheers

Quite a nice looking, if not old, train station. Lifts are provided on both platforms to give step free access to the street. A ticket office is open a good amount of the time and is located in a good part of the town. Facilities on the Ipswich platform are better than the Peterborough/Cambridge platform.

How does a rail station in a city the size of Bury St. Edmunds have a car park with only 23 spaces??  Absurd if you ask me.  What exactly are commuters in surrounding villages supposed to do?  Disgraceful!

Quite modern... Ticket office at entrance, barber shops next to the train station entrance,  nice good clean toilets, snack shop on departing platform, warm place to sit with sofas and disabled toilet inside too... Charging ports for phone/laptop/tablet
